intro: Rafnia gibba, commonly known as the knobbed sedge, is a flowering plant native to wetland habitats in North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its triangular stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Rafnia gibba produces small, three-lobed flowers in dense spikes, typically blooming in late summer. It plays an important role in wetland ecosystems by stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various wildlife species.
